# Documentation Guidelines

Comprehensive documentation standards for the AntiGravity Agent desktop application covering code documentation, user guides, and technical specifications.

## Documentation Philosophy

- Write documentation that serves both current and future developers
- Focus on explaining the 'why' behind decisions, not just the 'what'
- Keep documentation up-to-date with code changes
- Use clear, concise language that is accessible to all team members
- Provide examples and practical usage scenarios

## Code Documentation

- Use JSDoc for TypeScript/JavaScript functions, classes, and interfaces
- Document Rust functions and modules with proper doc comments
- Include parameter descriptions, return types, and usage examples
- Document complex algorithms and business logic decisions
- Explain non-obvious code sections and workarounds
- Document error handling and edge case behaviors

## API Documentation

- Document all Tauri commands with parameters and return types
- Provide usage examples for each command
- Document error conditions and handling strategies
- Include security considerations for each API endpoint
- Document rate limits, timeouts, and other constraints

## Architecture Documentation

- Maintain up-to-date architecture diagrams and descriptions
- Document the relationship between React frontend and Rust backend
- Explain system integration points and dependencies
- Document configuration and environment setup
- Explain deployment and build processes

## User Documentation

- Provide clear installation and setup instructions
- Document all user-facing features and capabilities
- Include troubleshooting guides for common issues
- Provide configuration examples and best practices
- Document system requirements and compatibility

## Security Documentation

- Document security architecture and threat model
- Explain encryption and data protection mechanisms
- Document security configuration and best practices
- Provide security audit and compliance information
- Document incident response procedures

## Development Documentation

- Maintain contributor guidelines and coding standards
- Document development environment setup
- Provide debugging guides and troubleshooting tips
- Document testing strategies and coverage requirements
- Explain release and deployment processes

## Configuration Documentation

- Document all configuration options and their effects
- Provide configuration examples for different use cases
- Explain configuration validation and error handling
- Document backup and restore procedures
- Explain configuration migration processes

## Tauri-Specific Documentation

- Document Tauri command implementations and purposes
- Explain IPC communication patterns and best practices
- Document system integration features (tray, notifications, etc.)
- Provide platform-specific configuration and considerations
- Document build and packaging processes

## Performance Documentation

- Document performance characteristics and benchmarks
- Explain optimization strategies and trade-offs
- Document resource usage patterns and limitations
- Provide performance monitoring and profiling guides
- Document scalability considerations

## Error and Troubleshooting Documentation

- Document common error scenarios and solutions
- Provide diagnostic steps for complex issues
- Explain log analysis and debugging techniques
- Document recovery procedures for system failures
- Maintain FAQ for frequently encountered issues

## Documentation Maintenance

- Review and update documentation with each release
- Validate examples and code snippets regularly
- Remove outdated information and broken links
- Update screenshots and visual documentation
- Maintain consistency in terminology and style

## Documentation Tools and Formats

- Use Markdown for most documentation files
- Generate API documentation from code comments
- Use appropriate diagrams for architecture and workflows
- Maintain documentation in version control
- Use consistent formatting and style conventions

## Accessibility in Documentation

- Use clear headings and document structure
- Provide alt text for images and diagrams
- Use high contrast colors and readable fonts
- Structure content for screen readers
- Provide multiple formats when appropriate

## Internationalization Documentation

- Document localization processes and requirements
- Provide translation guidelines and resources
- Document cultural considerations and adaptations
- Explain text expansion and UI layout considerations
- Document right-to-left language support

## Quality Assurance for Documentation

- Review documentation for accuracy and completeness
- Test examples and code snippets for correctness
- Validate links and references regularly
- Use spell checking and grammar tools
- Gather feedback from users and contributors

## Documentation Distribution

- Organize documentation in logical, discoverable structure
- Provide search functionality where possible
- Use appropriate cross-references and linking
- Maintain both online and offline documentation access
- Consider different audience needs (users, developers, administrators)
